intro: Blepharocalyx montanus, commonly known as the white-flowered huito, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, grayish bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
